results.title: I am here today (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A record of how 21 children aged 5, 6 and 7 interacted with each other as they made various things in the playroom. The children were from the same class, growing and changing together in the classroom since the previous September. Filmed in May 1969. A film study for teachers.

results.title: I am also a you
results.creator_credit: Jay Thompson, Bruce Kerner and Wonderful Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates similarity between pople of all ages and points of view, using images and quotations. Sources include the Bible, the Talmud, Buddha, Thomas Wolfe and Stanley Kubrick. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: I'm still a woman
results.creator_credit: Joyce Mann and Joyce Mann Productions
results.brief_description: Three weeks before her wedding, Mrs Joyce Mann discovered that she had a lump in her breast. After a mastectomy she and her husband found just how few facilities there were for women who were considered mutilated. Before a group of nurses, Mrs Mann explains and demonstrates her experience, and the underwear she has worn and now wears. Another cancer victim shows that now, at times breasts can be reconstructed.

results.title: I'm seventeen, I'm pregnant and I don't know what to do
results.creator_credit: David Crommie and Lee Mendelson Film Productions
results.brief_description: Dramatizes the plight of an unwed pregnant adolescent. With her parents, social workers and a discussion group at the Children’s Home Society of California, she considers the alternatives of abortion, forced marriage, temporary foster care, keeping the baby or relinquishing it for adoption.

results.title: I am how I look
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Explores how children view their physical selves and how that relates to the whole self-image. Includes children describing how they look, the importance of differences for helping one develop a sense of self-identity and specific suggestions for liking oneself better. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

group_siblings.title: I am what I know
group_siblings.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films

results.title: I'm feeling happy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
Children sing about and experience a number of things that bring happiness: The pleasures of smelling and eating good things, a bubbly bath, waking up on a sunny morning; the accomplishment of learning to drive, the inner satisfaction of being helpful without thought of reward and the warmth of sharing a friendship.

group_siblings.title: I am what I know
group_siblings.creator_credit: Glenda Fillinger, Paul Fillinger and Churchill Films

results.title: I am how I feel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Feelings”.
One of a series of three films dealing with the question “Who am I?”. Presents a series of sketches about the expression of feelings. Ways of handling negative feelings and achieving more positive feelings are shown. All people have the same basic emotions but respond differently in particular situations. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
